content.description: Look for the obvious right facing dihedral in the center of the wall leading up to a ledge. At the top it forks. Little Wing is a newer direct finish that goes straight up. Right Wing goes, you guessed it... right. The route requires gear to be led safely, otherwise it is very R rated. After the last bolt, you can place a yellow metolius a #2 cam. Â Shares an anchor with Sniper 12d.

Overhanging, blocky, and juggy!  Start in a squeeze chimney, pull onto a ramp, then head up the nicely featured face.  Crux is probably transitioning out of the chimney near the 2nd bolt.  Pretty steep for 5.10.
content.location: Furthest right route at the Bowling Ball, look for the obvious chimney/ramp feature.

content.description:
Clip 2 bolts in a right-facing corner, place a small piece, clip another bolt, then gain a rest on top of a large block. The upper wall is steep and juggy with another bolt and a couple more gear placements. Finish at the anchors directly above.

This route is a straight up variation to Left Wing and Right Wing, both of which end at anchors fairly far left and right, respectively, of the main route line.
content.location: Mixed route on the right side of the wall.

content.description:
Moderate face for a few bolts, then pull a crux bulge on long reaches between jugs.  Gain a no-hands rest above the bulge, then pull an easier crux moving left into good incut holds.  Finish on a short hand crack.

Pretty soft for .11d as Humboldt grades go, but really quality climbing.

Meander through some choss off the ground, then immediately pull a steep bulge on huge holds.  At the 6th bolt, head left (straight up is a 5.13+ project) through a slabby section and gain a no-hands rest after clipping the 7th bolt.

The crux comes pretty quick after the rest, getting into and moving past a poor left-hand sidepull.  However, the route stays pretty full-on all the way to the anchors.  Unlike "Fearless Leader" which is pretty soft for the grade, this one is pretty stout.  Killer route for the 5.12 climber.
content.location: Middle of the Bowling Ball, just right of a big madrone.
